label: 在地領主
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: A concept used by modern historians in reference to local warriors from the late Heian to the Sengoku periods who asserted full proprietary control over land to which they had originally held only limited shiki. This control was outside the centralized shōen system. In the medieval land system, the hierarchy included the absentee central proprietor (ryōke), the local overlord (zaichi ryōshu）, and the peasant.　[職、荘園、領家]
